content.question:
The figure shows the results of an experiment to investigate the effects of an enriched <math alttext="C O 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>2</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> environment on plant growth. Identical plants were separated into different groups and grown either in a standard <math alttext="C O 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mtext></mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> environment (400 ppm <math alttext="C O 2" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext></mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>2</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></math>) or in an enriched <math alttext="C O 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>2</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> environment (700 ppm <math alttext="C O 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>2</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>). Of the plants in each environment, half were grown under ideal conditions and half were grown under stressed conditions.

Based on the figure, which statement best describes the observed relationship between atmospheric <math alttext="C O 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>2</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> enrichment and plant growth under ideal and stressed conditions?

choices.label: The increase in atmospheric <math alttext="C O 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>2</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> had no observable effect on plant growth under either ideal or stressed conditions.

The increase in atmospheric <math alttext="C O 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>2</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> resulted in a greater increase in plant growth under ideal conditions than under stressed conditions.

The increase in atmospheric <math alttext="C O 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> resulted in a greater increase in plant growth under stressed conditions than under ideal conditions.

The increase in atmospheric <math alttext="C O 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>2</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> resulted in an inhibition of plant growth under both ideal and stressed conditions.

content.answer: The increase in atmospheric <math alttext="C O 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> resulted in a greater increase in plant growth under stressed conditions than under ideal conditions.

skill.text: 2.A: Describe characteristics of visual representations of biological concepts and processes.
